era como estar en casa y tal cual como las fotos
Mein Bett war sehr gemütlich. Die Gastgeberin ist zuvorkommend, freundlich und sehr bemüht. Das Haus hat sogar Garten, Terrasse und Balkon. Es ist für ein Hostel gut sauber.
Everything,  most beautiful decor and the most comfortable bed ever! I so loved it I added 3 more nights. Its a work of art, very peaceful, and lots of amazing free coffees in reception area.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Parking was actually ok but just need to watch out on Friday mornings and move your car. But each day, I found a spot within ten minutes.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Fantastic interior! Very cosy. Absolutely clean!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The walls are a bit thin ;-)

reviews_list.Review_Likes: style and cleanliness
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: room 3 didn’t have a window and the upstairs apartment was very loud until 2 am.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Despite not having a private bath, I never waited in line at any time. I would book again.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I felt safe in the neighborhood.The cleaning staff were very helpful and friendly.My messages/questions were answered in a timely manner
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The coffee maker only worked if unplugged and then plugged back in for a one-time use. Then repeat.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Very comfortable/fun place to stay in LA
reviews_list.Review_Likes: We loved the decor of our room; the bed was super comfy and the bathroom right across the hall. The whole place was kitted out really well, and was a quirky and interesting hotel to stay in during our visit to LA. I wouldn’t hesitate to recommend staying here.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The only thing I would change would be to ensure the bedroom lighting could be fully dark at night.

reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Good location, nice atmosphere.
Remote check-in worked fine.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The first shower was cold! Not nice! But truth be told. We called the property management and they did sent a technical maintenance guy during the same (late) evening to address the situation. The morning shower was nice and hot.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Location is good considering the price, it’s close to hollywood and central LA. Love the decorations and it’s actually my favourite part. Not to mention the staff are friendly and they clean the place daily.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The walls are extremely thin. I can definitely hear others when they are playing music and can also hear noises from outside. As mich as I loved staying there, others aren’t prone to following rules as they would play loud music past midnight which can disrupt your sleep.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Atmosphere is unique and super cool.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The bed is not so comfortable and the walls are very thin.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: everything
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: nothing

reviews_list.Main_Review: Great spot. And a hidden gem.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The local, the place, and overall everything.  I prefer staying in places that feel more like personal rooms than cookie-cutter hotels and drab furnishings.  Great spot close to loads of amenities and easy to navigate around even if you don't know the area.  More of a self-serving BnB... .  and already booked another stay.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Wish the towels were bigger and a little better quality..  Due to a glitch in the system of Booking.com, I was bumped.  The Rosemary did in fact rectify the situation and were very understanding of my situation,  I plan to stay here as my hub when I am locale to the area. Overall it's a great place and has top marks all around.

reviews_list.Main_Review: this was a comfortable and very affordable room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: the convenient location
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I had no problems with the property

reviews_list.Review_Likes: affordable and good location!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: very dark lighting, no clear fire exit signs, thin walls, locks on the door could have been more secure/stronger, tiny bath towels provided (and no larger ones bought when asked for more)

reviews_list.Review_Likes: wit was awesome interior … feeling like entered into old Hollywood movie
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: overall everything was awesome

reviews_list.Main_Review: Fantastic place to stay in LA for a very reasonable price!
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I loved everything about my stay here. It was relatively quiet (there was a party nearby on Friday that was loud, but quieted down a little after midnight). I loved how close I was to public transportation (several bus stops nearby/8-10 minute walk to Red Line at Sunset/Vermont). Great experience, overall!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It was very dark in the room, but I wasn't in there much, so whatever. This place ruled.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: paper thin walls - you can hear every single word from the people in the rooms next door. also not enough bathrooms/showers - tough to get some time in the bathroom in the mornings

reviews_list.Review_Likes: THEY NOW SERVE BREAKFAST. THIS LOCATION IS TOP NOTCHHHHHH. ONE BLOCK FROM THE PIER. TRADER JOES, TARGET, NORDSTROM AND THE STARBUCKS IS NEAR. I LOVE THIS PLACE!!

reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Really nice staff, free wifi, large kitchen and dining area. The location is great, walking distance to the beach and bars/restaurants close by.
Also bed was made already for you, towels provided!
PARKING:
Across the street is parking P6. But it's a bit pricy.
The hostel recommends the parking at 333 Civic Center. It is like 10 Mins walking distance and really cheaper. One over night parking (Fri-Sat) saved me 26 $!!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: My bed was horrible. Comfort was some sort of okay but with every little movement I made it was squeaking and creaking really loud. Not funny during the night.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Safe, clean and central - top shelf hostel!!! Will stay again.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Easy to get to if catching public transport from LAX.  Felt safer seeing a security guard at the front. The hostel itself exceeded my expectations, the kitchen was spacious, as was the dining room and there were multiple common areas throughout the property. It was also a very safe hostel and I think this has a lot to do with the no alcohol policy, it was never noisy or over run with loud drunk people - like some other hostels. The fireplace sitting area, mutiple charge points was an added bonus for anyone wanting to study/work in front of the fire. The library was also an added bonus if the common room downstairs was too busy. The extra bathrooms on our floor were a bonus. The housekeeping staff are amazing, always working hard around the clock to keep that place clean! They deserve a medal, its a busy hostel. I will definitely be booking in to stay again when I visit USA - LA. Staff were also super helpful with best advice on how to get to LAX - I had to be at airport at 4am, staff organised a taxi pick up for me as my sim card didnt work in country.
The kindness of the staff, location and comfort. Also, the free breakfast.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Sometimes the bathroom was not so clean, also there were showers/restrooms broken on the 4th floor and the room had a weird smell.

reviews_list.Main_Review: The best hostel I've ever stayed at
reviews_list.Review_Likes: It was SUPER clean, breakfast was good
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I didn't like there was no option to control the temp in the room and it was kinda stuffy in there

reviews_list.Review_Likes: great facility in awesome location

Always saw someone cleaning something, even at 9pm. Location very convenient, I just personally didn’t really like Santa Monica.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Very close to Santa Monica pier for not too much money (30$) for a night!

Great location! Pier is 5 mins walk, Trader Joe’s, Target 7-8 mins walk, there are so many restaurants near by. The hostel is clean, staff is super helpful and kind. Common areas are great and the kitchen… best kitchen what I’ve ever seen in hostels. Highly recommend this place.
great Location. everything is close by..

reviews_list.Review_Likes: I have been a guest occasionally for almost twenty years. the hostel has only improved in that time

reviews_list.Main_Review: Excellent value, great location, friendly staff, but bed frames could use improvement.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Really good location close to several bus lines (Metro, Big Blue Bus) and the Metro Expo line.  Rooms and all facilities seemed relatively new or well maintained.  There were enough full-sized lockers for every guest to have an individual one - unlike some hostels I've stayed at.  I didn't bring my child, but they apparently do allow children to stay in dorm rooms - I understand sharing a bed with an adult up to 12 or in an individual bed at 13-17.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It's Santa Monica, so there will be noises outside from the local homeless/mentally ill.  The bunk bed frames also creaked a lot and sounded like broken sofa springs anytime that I or a roommate moved.  If they could find a way to either fix or replace the beds, it would be perfect.  Also - they have a strict no alcohol policy (not even possession without consumption), which is unusual for hostels - and they ask that any alcohol brought in be held at the front desk until checkout.  But these were minor issues compared to everything that went well.

reviews_list.Main_Review: a big thank to the personnel All❣️

reviews_list.Main_Review: Great value for Santa Monica location, well run and safe facility all around, rooms can get stuffy.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: This hostel is run very well - a full staff for hospitality, cleaning, and security. Rooms require cards like a hotel so your stuff feels pretty safe, lockers in rooms available. Each floor had sufficient bathroom facilities such that waiting was never an issue. Common areas were cool, although most people were just on their cell phones not talking. On one of the nights there was a free comedy show, legit LA comedians too, very enjoyable. Location is right in Santa Monica near the beach/peer - it can get a bit crazy on the streets but no complaints about being central.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: My only complaint here is the climate control. The temperature seems excessively warm in rooms and the heater never seemed to shut off despite mild outside temperatures. I initially had a top-bunk but had to switch down because I could barely breathe up there. Some rooms have windows that can be opened, but some don't so can be difficult to air out a stuffy room. The breakfast is very basic and bread focused.

reviews_list.Main_Review: The place and people is great and I indicate for everyone.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everything was amazing!!
Service impeccable!👍👍👍

Everything is great for this hostel. But I'd like to point out if as others pointed, you park your car at one of the Santa Monica parking garage nearby (there's one just cross the street) overnight, you will be charged daily maximum x 2 ($40-45) rather than 1 day max. They have a stupid policy which charges you a full day for the evening time and a full day from 0:00 am to early morning. So even if you parked there for like 14 hours, you are charged 2 days' max.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Happy to be in L.A. & this hostel was nice to stay at if you plan to be out of it much of the time.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I like most things about the physical aspect of the hostel. enough showers, toilets etc. Common room was spacious and nice to be in. I liked the location as it was a tiny bit away from busy areas, but easy to get to points of interest as it is somehow centrally located.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The staff was very weird.. not friendly, rather cold and awkward to be around. There were no metal forks, only unnecessary plastic products not good for the environment! The staff complained about listening to the news on the iphone while showering at 2pm, yet the blowdryer was ok to be heard at the same volume from the adjacent restroom for the same amount of time.Tiptoeing around the staff, as to not 'do anything wrong', is not a fun time.. Macho staff not friendlily engaging with male guests.. only females. If you're a guy, and just want a place to sleep, then you'll be fine here, just don't try to converse with the staff.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Perhaps the fact that you cant drink or do marijuana on property, like even the rooftop

reviews_list.Main_Review: Perhaps the best you can get, for the price, in LA
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The Melrose hostel is centrally located, clean, and comfortable. The staff is very friendly (maybe a little too friendly at times :p) but overall very accomodating. The beds were tall enough to sit up in, and the bathrooms and kitchen were very clean too. Bus stops right outside are able to take you everywhere you need to go, and there is a shopping center with Target (plus groceries) a 20 minute walk away.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The beds need curtains - like so many other hostels all over the world are providing these days. Even though you're in a room with only women, it is nice to not have to be woken up by their early morning or late night activities. A curtain helps with this. When I hung my travel blanket (very small) so that it would provide me this privacy I found a passive-aggressive note on my bed later from the owner that told me that I would be kicked out if I didn't take it down. I thought this was ridiculous and, in some ways, treated us adult guests like children. I politely obeyed this demand - but only during the day - at night I put it back up because at the end of it all I am a paying customer and it isn't my fault if this hostel hasn't modernized to align with the norms of hostels worldwide.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Good bathrooms. Outdoor area with Hollywood sign view.
It is a nice hostel, rooms are spacious and the rooftop is cool!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Would have liked to have a breakfast option in the hostel. There are no good breakfast restaurants in the neighborhood.

although i did see staff cleaning everyday, i’m not sure what they’re cleaning in the bathrooms. the floor and counter all seemed fine but when it came to the little things i found myself constantly trying to avoid touching it, like the walls in the shower or even the shower curtain because there was visible dirt. the floor in the shower is very dirty but if you wear shower slippers it is fine i guess.  would be better with a drying mat to help with the floor getting wet. 
you have to take the metro to go to any pharmacy or grocery store, it’s not a very walkable area and everything is close if you drive but far if you take the bus or walk.

Staff are lovely and showed me everything even though I got there after the designated check in time. Great facilities and can see the Hollywood sign from the roof which is cool!

Perfect for healthy meals at any time and a good coffee in the morning.

I had a fantastic time at Melrose! I stayed a little less than a week in the female dorm. 
the dorm holds around 18 ppl but everyone was really calm and lovely, so I got to make loads of travel buddies with a super diverse group of people in age, nationality and travel reason. 
the staff was super helpful and the hostel facilities were super convenient with the roof top, great shower facilities and the kitchen plus lounge area.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: airconditioning wasn’t working while I was there in the room, so we kept the windows open. due to the amount of traffic outside however it was pretty loud. other than that it would be fab to have a bit more kitchen equipment like proper knives and salt and pepper and oil and if I could wish for one thing specifically, it would be privacy curtains for all beds.

reviews_list.Main_Review: You get what you pay for
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Hostel has a lovely rooftop which would be great for warm weather. Also has a spacious lower common area with filtered water. They provide free ear plugs & wifi.
Night taco van & bus stop right across the road was handy.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It is very noisy at night as it is a busy road. The bathrooms could do with a deep clean or even a reno. The stairs and floors are terribly loud and creaky walking on. The hostel manager is welcoming but I felt as though he oversteps the boundary of professionalism, especially if you are a solo female traveller.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Nice hostel but dodgy area after dark
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Friendly staff and great views from the rooftop, nice kitchen. Clean considering the amount of guests.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Dorms are quite close together and you can actually hear the people next door snore.The 12 bed female room is too big and people can be very noisy after quiet time, and there's no one in reception after 6pm.Both female rooms overlook a very busy and noisy street. Some people seem to live there and have there personal belongings blocking windows and other areas.There aren't enough showers or toilets, although they keep the ones they have clean. But again some guests are not respectful. The area isn't safe at night, so if you're a woman, you have to Uber after 10pm. If you drive, parking is difficult. All metered around and very little space elsewhere, also dangerous to walk to hostel at night.

не очень чистые номера, маленькие шкафчики, маленькие душевые где всего один крючок, парковка только на улице (часто мест нет, поэтому нужно искать на других улицах),полотенце не выдают и не говорят о том, что его нет. но при этом можно его купить за 5$, правда есть один нюанс, что время работы персонала с 11 утра до 6 вечера. по этой же причине насчитаться наличными можно только в этом время. т.е. когда утром ты понимаешь, что полотенца нет, купить ты его не можешь, пока работник не придет.в целом, очень неудобный хостел.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Этот хостел позиционировался как не берущий предоплату, но взял мгновенно.Они вообще меня не впустили, я приехал после полуночи, стучался в двери, звонил на их телефон, но никто не ответил.Я там так вообще и не остался, а деньги они не вернули при переписке.И вообще этот хостел жалко выглядел.Думаю стоило бы его вообще перекрыть и оставить без нечестного заработка.Пишут, что не беру предоплату и бесплатно отменяют бронирование, но с моей карты и сняли деньги за два дня и не отменили бронирование.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: When we arrived they tried to charge US 200 Bucks more because they didn't comunícate well between the staff that they were putting us in a higher price room because of fixings to be done. We had to fight for like half an hour to solve It.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: It was my first time in Los Angeles and I'm so glad I picked Samesun as my to go place. The hostel is VERY well located and it's so easy to arrive there from anywhere in the city - bus and metro stops across the street just made our life SO easy. There's a mini market downstairs and a lot of food chains and shopping malls steps from our door so getting food never was something to worry about. We loved the free breakfast - it was very simple but we always felt pretty full. We had a shared bathroom but it was pretty close to our room and it was pretty clean - never had to wait for using showers or toilets. The room was very  spacious and the bed was so comfy! It definitely is worth the money and I'd recommend anyone to stay there!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: More spaces for having breakfast would be nice - but not a deal breaker or anything.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I would have given a 10 if I hadn't met the black guy with glasses at the front desk; he was rude, lazy, unpleasant, I would say inhuman, he treated me and guests lined up in front of me very badly, our presence there was annoying him, he did everything to make my stay uncomfortable. He must learn many, many things about his job, otherwise he could bring the hostel to ruin. On the contrary, the next day Carlos was an excellent guy, respectful, kind, polite and gave me suggestions about my stay in Hollywood.

reviews_list.Main_Review: pleased with experience and would stay again
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Unbeatable location, literally between everywhere you want to be in Hollywood. good breakfast, especially for being included in the price

I like everything where was available there there us bilyard and the seting area and the kitchen very nice and the breakfast also very good  the location is very good where you can find all by the walking distance. From metro also very close the hostel.

I loved the location since you only have to cross the street to access the subway and the bus stop. Although it is in front of the street, my room was not noisy. The kitchen is good equiped and you have access to cold and warm purified water 24/7
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The breakfast is ok but it is missing some protein and a little of variety, like milk and other fruit.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everything looks exactly like the pics. Located at a super strategic place, I went to a concert at the Hollywood bowl and I walked like 10 minutes from the hostal to the venue. The price is good for what you get. Everything is so clean, common spaces are big enough, with a great view to the Hollywood walk of Fame at the kitchen and the main common room. I was very surprised of how calm and quiet it is at night, no noise was filtered from the walk of Fame. There's a 24 hr market below the hostal (hostal is on the 2nd and 3rd floor of the building), also there's a public parking behind the building and I payed 30 USD for a overnight parking (I arrived at 4 pm and left 11 am next day). ATM at the kitchen. The whole staff is so nice and helpful and many of them are bilingual (English and Spanish). They offer you breakfast from 7 am to 9 am: 3 types of bagels to choose, cream cheese, jelly, butter, oranges, oat bars, coffee and tea. Dispensers with fresh water available for everyone at any time. Wifi was great.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Girl's bathroom only at 3rd floor. It would be great if you have genderless bathrooms in both flats of the hostal so everyone can have accessible showers and restrooms wherever your room is. My mattress wasn't firm enough.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: unbeatable location if you want to see the typical hollywood sights (walk of fame, the chinese theater, etc)
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: nearly transparent bathroom doors for the shower cubicles, and no locks; $10 for the laundry because you need to reserve the room for 2 hours and you basically have 2 washers and dryers to yourself;

reviews_list.Main_Review: 3 nights to explore Hollywood while waiting for my car from rental company
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I liked included breakfast which was something uncommon for such price and it tasted really good.I got a room with some spanish guys and they respected all the rules so my experience was excellent but it may be different based on the people you're matched with so keep that in mind.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: There was nothing that left me unsatisfied.

reviews_list.Review_Likes:
The location was great
Staff was super nice and responsive
You have a possibility to store your luggage for free
AC in the rooms
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
The rooms were a little bit dark
Only one restroom for women so sometimes there was a line for the shower or the sink

reviews_list.Review_Likes:
It was the 1st time I shared a room and I was very apprehensive.  Mainly because it is a mixed room.  But the experience was very good, I met nice and respectful people.  The hostel has a bath towel, sheets, blanket, pillow;  in the bathroom there is liquid soap, shampoo, conditioner, free of charge.  There is a drinking fountain with cold water.  The staff were polite and helpful.  Breakfast is very simple, just loaf of bread, butter, cheese spread, orange and coffee.  But you can buy and make your own breakfast.
 Despite the hostel being on the walk of fame, a busy avenue, I didn't hear noise at night to the point of disturbing my sleep, even though I'm a super light sleeper.  One of the beds in my room made noise in the springs for any movement of the guest, this is bad.
 The hostel complies exactly with the Checkin and Checkout time, there is no option to enter the room before 3pm, nor stay in the room after 11am;  but you can stay at the hostel, use the sofa, bathroom, kitchen, etc, except the bedroom.
 I really liked it.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: everything is OK

reviews_list.Main_Review: The staff were lovely and the complimentary breakfast was yum!
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The staff were above and beyond helpful + friendly!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The rooms look a bit different to the images provided

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Location is great if you want to be in the heart of Hollywood AND don´t mind the noise. Subway is across the street. You can rent you Lamborghini directry in front of the house. Rooms are clean, showers are hot and a simple breakfast is included. There is a kitchen and a free pool table plus a great (streaming) wifi. Awesome!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I didn´t FIND it and had to run around the house before it realized i was standing in front of it!! To be fair: the modest and unasuming sign above the door leading to a steep no-elevator-staircase (tricky with heavy bags) has to compete against shine and splendour of signs from Disney, Ripley and co. But be aware - it is just a small door on the corner...

reviews_list.Review_Likes: The breakfast

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everything was perfect, aside of my constructive crtiticisim...

reviews_list.Main_Review: helpful staff, great location, good vibes hostel.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Location was great, it is noisy being right on the busy strip of Hollywood blv but that is part of the attraction, I had a window to see the main strip, across from road the metro and anything touristy. Staff were great and accomodating 24/7. Room has decent size locker for each bunk, bathrooms are decent, clean and private with seperate dressing room area, toilets and showers. Lounge/common area open 7am- 12am good for some social interaction as a solo traveller, tables, couches and pool table inviting to the social environment, plus luggage storage all day when you check in/out. I did not try the breakfasts or use the kitchen facilities, but they looked clean and tidy. I would stay here again.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: bunk beds are a little squeaky when getting on and off, keys into the rooms sometimes need a little juggle, mostly just out of care for bothering those already sleeping, but its part of the hostel experience right!

If you like Korean food it would be a dream location. Uber on the other hand- not cheap. That isn't the hostels responsibility.

He also had a unpleasant attitude and overcharged me for my stay, even after I showed him the correct price it should be from Booking.com! (this was corrected as few days later after I emailed The Rumi). NB: the included details are incorrect - it states towels ARE included in the price. They are NOT, as I was made to pay an extra $2 for mine. Poor email communication - I contacted them a few times with questions before arrival and again afterwards, but have had no any reply to any of them to date.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Have no expectations of politeness/privacy/professionalism/any kind of comfort and you'll be fine.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The staff (a manager?) who checked me in was probably one of the only people I found actually competent, although he spoke very fast about important details and it was difficult to keep up (and I am a native english speaker).
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
The vibe was very strange here.
I am a Canadian who visits the US every year or two and I usually feel I can stay anywhere as I think myself understanding/adaptable/not fussy, but even I struggled with trying to wrap my head around this place.
If you're an outgoing person who doesn't mind having very little privacy or customer service/are really just passing through, you'll do fine. However things such as rude staff who are cold/impolite, staff who also stay in the shared dorms with you, staff who don't stock toilet paper in the bathrooms, staff who have a sincere lack of professionalism and beg their coworkers(?) for food in the common areas... the list goes on.
The female staff will do a "courtesy knock" but don't wait for you to answer and walk in on you changing, they will bang around with no regard for if anyone is sleeping/barge in before 9am while travellers are asleep (with no previous warning) and clean the bathroom poorly (with very strong cleaning products) and did not turn on the exhaust/left the bathroom wide open and gave all the people in the room a headache. At one point there was no hot water for a whole day/night and I was told "sometimes its just like that" and to be patient.
Again, maybe some folks find this all OK. And if we were given notice about things or were treated more politely I could have understood, since this is "just a hostel" and I understand that it's not meant to be some grand experience. But as someone who has stayed in many hostels around the world, this might be one of the worst ones simply because I did not feel welcome and felt the staff very strange/disrespectful and the experience too baffling.
The actual manager (owner?) himself seemed very adept and kind (when he was actually around) but he made a mistake hiring almost every staff member because the incompetence made the whole experience incredibly uncomfortable.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Shower and Room was clean. Location in Koreatown is amazing. Many Restaurants and Bars. Fast Wifi.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Our shared 4 Person Room was supposed to be 19m2 (approx. 200 sq feet). Actual size was roughly half of it. Also the Rooms are promoted with private bathroom. They are not, there are normal shared bathrooms with everyone in the hostel. Description also states that towels are provided. However they are not, they can be ordered for an extra fee. Kitchen could be cleaned better.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: low cost
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: crowded surroundings both inside and outside.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Nice location.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
First of all, the place isn't easy to find as there's no sign outside saying that the particular door leads to the hostel grounds. If you're able to find a member of the hostel staff indoors, you're lucky because the reception is in the middle of the kitchen and you can't really tell who's part of the staff and who's just a guest.
The room itself was mostly clean if you don't look into the fridge, which wasn't. The beds do not have separate reading lamps or power sockets.
Standing lamp in the room was broken.
There was also a mice problem on the community balcony and staff went through people's belongings and threw stuff that looked like trash away, which is unacceptable. Did I want to complain about all this is person? Yes. Was there ever visible staff around? No.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Wonderful locator near the heart of ktown. Easily accessible by public transportation.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Staff was unhelpful to the point of being condescending. I asked a question at 10:15 PM about whether I needed to do anything special for checkout, since I was leaving at 6 AM the next morning. Instead of giving me a straight response of “no”, the volunteer said several times “I stop working at 10 PM. You’ll need to pay me $25 for me to answer your questions.” I’ve been backpacking around the world for a year at this point, and have generally had wonderful experiences with volunteers who share their time off to answer questions and share travel advice. Unfortunately, that doesn’t happen here. Another staff member asked me where I’m from. I said “American” to which he half-jokingly, half-seriously responded “oh, boring. I only like Asians…and sometimes Latinos.” I was born in China. Maybe it was a joke, but definitely rubs me the wrong way and comes across as fetishizing Asians, considering the hostel is in ktown.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Soo many things I didn't like. The staff was not welcoming. The rooms smelt horrible. I looked around the bed and it hasn't been swept or mopped properly in a long while. There weren't any toiletries. So much darn clutter. It needs clearing and updating. The worst part 15 rats were moving around. Very uncomfortable!

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Only the friendly employee was trying to make living better.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
The room is described 18 square meters, it is around 10sm (seriously) with 2 bunk beds, 4 people in total in 10 sm!!!! 
When I arrived the employee gave me one bed, I left and returned late at night, the bed was taken from someone else. I went to the bed that was empty, there was no one to ask for information and of course the other guests were sleeping, so it wasn't their fault. In the morning I asked one of them and they told me that those were the beds they were given... And that mine seemed occupied by another person, you can understand that I slept on used bedsheets... Of course I was sleeping with clothes and put a t-shirt on the pillow because at that time I had limited options.... 
Also the room  is described as having a private bathroom, in a hostel that means that every room has their bathroom, inside the room, no need to take all your stuff to get out of your room... 
That is totally wrong again in the description... 
The bathrooms and showers and restrooms are outside the rooms. 
Of course the rooms were in a very bad situation and they were not clean, the lockers were very small.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: I saw a cockroach within five minutes of my arrival.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I didn't know there was any breakfast. There were a fair amount of restaurants within walking distance, but a little pricey and mostly just Korean food.  The area was a little sketchy around the hostel, but once you got onto Wilshire Blvd, it was OK. There's a Ralph's grocery store, but going in there was like entering an armed camp, with security confronting people at the entrance and exit. One guy going in with a box in his shopping cart was being strongly advised not to shoplift by the guard. I was also overcharged for what I bought. The hostel was within walking distance of the Metro but the area seemed pretty removed from everything.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: When I arrived the one staff member was sitting at the table eating a meal. A guy standing just inside the door sort of confronted me when I walked in, looking at me as if I was an intruder (as did everyone else in the room). The staff guy got up and checked me in; he was perfectly civil though not especially welcoming. When he saw my ID, he informed me that California residents were only allowed to stay one night, as they cater to foreign travelers mainly. There was nothing about that online when I made the booking, but they don't even have their own website (websites cost money). It is a small one-family house split into two apartments, upstairs and downstairs, and crammed with dozens of bunk beds. It was extremely cramped and crowded. The pictures on the Facebook page do not look like any part of the hostel I saw; they may have been of the second floor. The one or two rooms I glimpsed from the hallway looked every bit as crowded as mine, which was in a separate building (some kind of storage shed) behind the house. You had to go outside to get to it, but the area between the buildings was fenced in on both sides, so the only way in or out was to walk the single, twisting corridor all the way through the house to the front door, the only exit. This makes for an extreme fire hazard and is almost certainly illegal. The kitchen is at the very front of the house, right next to the door, so if a fire started there everyone in the building would be trapped. The "view" from the window in my room (which was covered by a metal grate) was of a cement wall about a foot away from the building. The beds were the usual cheap metal bunks that make a ton of noise. It was a cool night, which made it uncomfortable because these 3 Japanese guys came in after midnight and went in and out at least half-a-dozen times over the next hour, leaving the door wide open whenever they were in the room. Towels were not provided and they ran out of toilet paper in the morning.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Dave was incredibly welcoming as soon as I arrived- the ambiance of the place is basically unmatchable! Calming, quiet music, bright and airy common spaces, generously sized pods with the most comfy bedding I've ever slept on (legit) and plenty of tea and coffee options available for guests. There's shampoo and conditioner in the showers which is handy, and even low lighting inside the pods (as well as bright) if you want to read before bed. You're about 2 seconds from Venice boardwalk and plenty of bars and cafes within reach. If you don't want to splash out for a hotel, definitely check this place out. Regardless, the atmosphere is way cooler than any hotel would be, anyway! Its the perfect blend of personal space and social, so you can choose to network or keep to yourself as you wish.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: amazing property and even more amazing staff
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: pods are a nice concept, proximity to the beach, work space all around, bikes for free, and the most important, the staff. Dave is awesome!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The aesthetic and very accommodating staff
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: no parking space

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: This is the best place I’ve ever stayed on my solo travel around US. I would say it’s something between 5* hotel filled with the hostel concept. Staff is super nice, villa is spacious & clean. They offer 5* facilities and the view from the rooftop is stunning. If I will visit LA again this will be my place to stay!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: It’s more like a big shared loft than just a hostel. Amazing experience, best hostel I’ve ever stayed at, highly recommended!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Just Amazing (yes, with a capital A)
reviews_list.Review_Likes: location is one of the perks (right at the beach with some stunning views), price is very decent in these conditions, but the facilities (impressive cleanliness, spacious, lots of cooking and cleaning items you can use, as well as towels, shower gel and shampoo) and people there make you feel more at home/with your friends rather than in an overnight place to stay; this place is so cool, it's simply amazing

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I like the ambience. You can relax or work here- the sleeping capsules are very comfy. The location and staff are great!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Great location, just by the beach, everyone is respectful. Warm and welcoming environment and a great opportunity to meet other travellers! Bikes to use on site and being next to Venice beach was great for swimming and surfing.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: In general good work life combination
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I was working for the first three days which worked out awesome! Hight adjustable tables and seperate space to work.At the weekend it's not like a common hostel where everybody goes crazy. It's very mature.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It could feel more "home" at some points. But matching work and life in one location seems a little hard.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The facilities are amazing, the staff and the vibe are awesome!It's ideal if you want to work from there and stay for a few weeks.I was only there for the weekend but I really enjoyed chilling with the people there, from the rooftop, to the chilling areas where you can enjoy reading in the sun.Thank you guys for such a great welcome!!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Nothing at all.I would say that this is a place for people who enjoy socializing but not party animals.It is ideal for working remotely.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Awesome location and available bike
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Nothing

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: amazing location,  great facilities . totally true can’t hear anything outside when sleeping in the pod
reviews_list.Review_Likes: great location
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: took a little long to find the front door ! haha but not really a big deal

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Amazing. probably even better than an airbnb
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: pods give full privacy, can’t beat location

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Incredible value for money paid, perfect location, great staff!
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The staff was excellent, super friendly. The location is really hard to beat, right next to venice beach in the best zone possible. The housing has everything you may need and everything super organized.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Size of the pods is not the best if you're really tall but I managed still!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
I’ve been in 30+ hostels all over the US during the last years and this one definitely takes the crown!
The sleeping pods have everything you could ever need and even more. The house just has a wonderful, open vibe to it and everyone is so welcoming and helpful.
It’s also the first hostel I’ve been to, that really looks like in the pictures (even better, the view from the rooftop is incredible). There’s so much space for everyone and the pods, bathrooms, etc are clean and well cared for. 
The price may seem high at first, but it’s absolutely worth it (They also provide free coffee+water, laundry and bath utilities).
 Can’t wait to stay here again!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: luxury hostel in the best spot in LA
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everything was great, probably the best hostel I have ever done. Awesome amenities, awesome people, not a lot of people at the same time (maximum 10). The view on the beach is unbeatable. the pod is an awesome idea, you can close it and be in perfect pitch black to sleep.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Only the bed was a bit small for my taste.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: This place is an absolute must if you're staying in Los Angeles. Super friendly staff, that do everything in their power to make sure you have the best stay possible. Best location in la right on the beach. Free bicycles to take out for the day. Free coffee every morning.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Nothing

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: can’t say enough nice things about this place! i will for sure be back. the staff is incredible, everyone is so respectful and met the coolest people.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: can’t think of a single thing I would change! they even asked me when I was there (amazing customer service) and I literally was like nothing!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: almost everything was beyond my expectations. for sure i will be back again
reviews_list.Review_Likes: almost everything was beyond my expectations. for sure i will be back again
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: nothing, it was perfect

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Location, service and facility was great!!
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everything was awesome!   The location is fantastic, the building has a fun, modern, open feel.  Service was great.  Highly recommend it, would stay again for sure.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Nothing!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Out of all hotels we had during our America trip that was definitely the best one! Very nice host, perfectly clean and silent!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: One of the best places I’ve ever stayed. It hits the sweet spot between the normal hostel (fun and social but hardly comfortable) and a hotel (more than you need and no community). If you’re looking for something in between, I couldn’t recommend this enough. A few of the highlights for me in no particular order:- friendly and helpful staff- comfortable and quiet pods with light for reading and USB and power for charging - space to store your gear and a locker you can set your own code for to keep valuables (no need for a padlock)- amazing location right on Venice beach with an incredible view from the roof terrace- full kitchen with space to store food, coffee machines (nespresso and percolator), fresh water, and ice - sit stand desks if you need to work or do admin  - bikes to borrow for free to go explore plus yoga mats and a roller. Though I couldn’t take part, they also had HIIT and yoga sessions. - great bathrooms with towels (including beach) included plus body wash, shampoo, and conditioner- loads of space to lounge about and chat with the others around
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: That my stay wasn’t longer!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Comfy pods in warm community experience by the beach.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Great location, friendly and helpful staff, activities and events that guests can participate in.  Bright, warm atmosphere.  Affordable price given the location right on Venice beach.  Pods are comfortable.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Not much space to put my luggage, we all had our luggage in a pile on the floor by where we slept.  Also, the way the space is designed, there is open space between some of the floors (think of a loft).  This is nice and open during the day but because a bit of an issue when some people were watching TV on the lower level and I was heading to bed in a pod above.  I was able to close my pod door and that blocked much of the sound but not all of it, as there were no walls between the spaces despite being on different floors.  I was tired and fell asleep quickly but this could have kept me up.  I could have said something but really didn't want to bother the folks watching TV and felt that if the lower level had a proper ceiling to separate it from the rest, it wouldn't have been an issue.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: very clean, comfortable and inviting!

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Perfect location, it has a beautiful beach view. Beds were quite comfy and clean, but the ventilator in the pods was a bit noisy so earplugs are recommended (as expected). Also there are cool bikes you can take for the beach ride which I recommend!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: The photos simply don’t do the place justice. Spectacular mezzanine and amazing balcony.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Great location and beautiful interior
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: 3pm check in. Why does it take 4hrs to turn around a bed?! There are only 10 beds so probably only a couple people checking out each day and there are two staff and a cleaner.Unwillingness to look after my hand luggage post 11am check in for a few hours prior to a flight. This is the first time I have ever encountered such a situation (I am 45 and lucky enough to have travelled widely and stayed in a fair few hotels!) Churlish at best, they wanted to charge me $30 for a day pass!  At absolutely zero inconvenience to the staff they could have made my plane catch that little bit easier.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: El lugar es mucho mejor de lo esperado. Los pods son muy cómodos, amplios, limpios. Me encantó que dan la sensación de privacidad que uno teme no tener al ir a este tipo de hoteles, uno cierra la puerta y se siente en un cuarto para uno solo. Los baños y la cocina se mantienen demasiado limpios, todo es super moderno, tienen café gratis y me gustó que tienen espacios marcados específicos para cada persona colgar la toalla y poner su comida en la nevera. La decoración es super linda, se nota que pensaron en cada detalle. Los espacios comunes son muy cómodos y la casa es tan grande que no se siente casi la presencia de los otros huéspedes, lo cual da una sensación de silencio y tranquilidad muy especial, pero a la vez el set up permite socializar y hacer amigos, me fui con 3 nuevos amigos!  La ubicación es perfecta, al frente de toda la playa, con restaurantes cercanos, Abbot Kinney a unos minutos caminando, entonces se puede tener fácil acceso a todo, también al transporte público.El internet para trabajar también súper bueno.Me encantó el lugar, volvería siempre!!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Das stay open ist ein besonderes Hostel mit Charme. Tolle location, sehr nette Leute, der Host hilft immer weiter. Es sind viele digitale Nomaden da so dass man auch in Ruhe arbeiten kann.
Als ich ankam hat jemand Brot gebacken, ein paar Tage später machte jemand cookies für alle. Wie eine große WG in der man aber seine Ruhe haben kann wenn man es möchte. 
 Die location ist sehr gut ausgestattet, man fühlt sich sofort wohl. 
Die Betten sind sehr bequem, man hat viel mehr Privatsphäre als in anderen Hostels. 
Ich komme wieder.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: 英語が喋れずうまくコミュニケーションがとれない私にも親切に対応してくれました。施設内も清潔でロケーションも良く、夜は静かで熟睡できました。

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
사진 그대로의 숙소. 넓고 깨끗하고 조광이 좋은데다 시설도 좋다!
숙소 직원이 상주하고, 매우 친절하게 인폼을 줘서 좋았음. 문의사항이 있으면 바로바로 해결이 가능한 점도 장점.
앱으로 인스턴트 전자 키 를 사용해서 시간 관계 없이 편하게 다닐 수 있음. 
잠자는 캡슐이랑 씻는곳이 층이 달라서 생각보다 시끄러운 느낌도 없음. 
주방시설이 아주 예쁘고 좋고, 온갖 조미료도 다 비치되어있다. 냉장고에 얼음+정수기가 설치되어있어서 언제든 편하게 먹을 수 있고, 비치된 커피포트, 캡슐커피도 무제한으로 뽑아먹을 수 있음. 캡슐 침구도 깨끗하고 폭신했고, 내부도 생각보다 넓고 충전단자도 많았다. 
겨울이라 사용하진 않았지만, 내부에 개인용 미니 선풍기도 있었음.
화장실 맞은편에 런더리룸이 있어서 타올류를 무한 맘대로 사용 가능.(핸드,얼굴,바디 + 비치타올 별도로 있음)
내부에 자전거도 두대 있음. 사전에 이야기하면 대여해준다함.
화장실 두개. 4층 건물인데 소규모 숙소라 화장실 모자르단 느낌은 못받음. 생각보다 정말 집 화장실같아러 매우 편하게 씀.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Formidable expérience, dormir dans des pods, très agréable, le site est sécuritaire très bien situé avec tout à proximité. Un vélo est disponible librement sur place ce qui fut bien apprécié. L'endroit est calme et l'accès à une cuisine complète est parfait.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: El staff super amable !!! No trataron increíble!!! Y el lugar realmente superó mis expectativas, claro que volvería a stay open nuevamente !!!The staff was super kind !!!they treated us incredible, and the place exceed all my expectations, for sure a place to come back again !!!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Non potrò mai consigliare abbastanza questo posto! 
Ambiente grande, pulito e luminoso, curato nei minimi dettagli, affacciato sulla spiaggia.
Ideale per lavorare come per incontrare gente interessante, in un'atmosfera amichevole e rilassata.
Avevo prenotato per una settimana, me ne sono andata dopo due, a malincuore; viaggio spesso da sola ed in nessun altro posto mi sono trovata così a mio agio.
Nonostante la struttura sia di per sé eccezionale, la vera differenza la fa il personale ( nessuno escluso ): gentile, disponibile, divertente; assolutamente il migliore in cui mi sia imbattuta finora. 
Tornerò sicuramente appena ne avrò l'occasione!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: стильно, красиво, в кровати спать одно удовольствие - действительно проваливаешься в сон из за мягкости постели. очень крутой вид на океан, и возможность занятий йогой. потрясающий хостел для одиночных поездок, новых знакомств, уединенного времени для работы и чтения. мне очень понравилось. очень важно, что публика приличная!

tout est excellent parfait literie cuisine salons rooftop

Accueil formidable de la gérante qui nous a montré tous les endroits de cette auberge accessibles à tous. l’auberge est grande, lumineuse, décorée avec goût, confortable et sécuritaire, par ailleurs la vue sur la mer par la fenêtre ou le rooftop est un vrai plus. J’ai vraiment passé un moment génial ici, je m’y suis sentie bien. L’accès à la mer est fou, seulement quelques pas ! De plus des vélos sont prêtés gratuitement si besoin. Je recommande

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The fridge was dirty. The air wasnt turned on, I had to ask them to turn it on. I found that weird in a shared environment. The stairs to get to the bunk bed were hard on my feet.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Location.  Super central to everything.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Being told that giving my email address is required to stay there.  So, I guess people who don't use technology are not welcome here?  Some people just do not want marketing emails.  Apparently, they are also not welcome here?  Seems like a terrible policy for a business to have.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Now in Sacramento, working on a Bill for Seniors, thanx for the relaxation.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Breakfast??  The pod was comfy & private.  I liked that.  Got a lot done with your wifi.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I’m a Senior woman relocating from Hollywood, it was FULL of men.  Thought I was in a Frat house.  Unless I asked a question, Maddie, the admin, never spoke to me, even when I greeted her.  I remember being a young lady and chatting with young men. It was an important “service”.  I was definitely a tenant, not a guest.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Has the potential to be awesome, but let down by staff, lack of facilities.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Location was very central, right by the farmers market. The inside itself was quite nice; cool beds and bathroom; it could be really nice if they were a bit more practical/better at customer service.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Overall a weird experience - our uber dropped us off, but we couldn't find it. There's no sign. We called and they didn't pick up, but eventually we were let inside, but couldn't check in. The girl at reception was playing a computer game and didn't want to talk to us until later. She seemed unhappy to answer any questions, but maybe that's just a California thing? She was friendlier once her computer game finished. There was only one bathroom, which had the shower and toilet inside, so a bit of a wait in the morning.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Off the Hollywood Boulevard, but area felt quite unsafe at night as it’s slightly away from the busier bit (Chinese theatre, Dolby theatre)
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Location is unsafe, only one bathroom for whole hostel (about 9 beds). Two of the beds are more like pods (much smaller in size with only enough room to sleep, but at same cost which seems unfair.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Good location and service.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Common area and rooms are on the same space.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: The kitchen was nice. The place was bugless & clean. The prices are not outrageous. The other guests were friendly & respectful.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Reports that ppl who complained were immediately moved to a different podshare location prevent me from complaining about a specific onsight staff member whose presence made the atmosphere there particularly uncomfortable and uptight because of this persons impersonal ways of engaging and generally antisocial unfriendly attitude with the guests. This person was the only issue COLLECTIVELY. Bell the manager there was a complete mensch however ; helpful kind & attentive.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: I loved the location because you are in the middle of Hollywood and the concept of the hostel was awesome!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
One night, one of the customers was discussing with a friend, (a person who wasn’t staying there) shouting and was too late.
Then he started watching a movie without airpods and was too late again.. was a litter bit horrible because he has told us that if we would make noise we have to go outside the hostel..

reviews_list.Review_Likes: walking distance from almost everything you’d need
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: didn’t feel comfortable/safe around some of the other guests

reviews_list.Review_Likes: It was super well localised. Super easy if you want to visit Hollywood by walk
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The place was not super clean and it was cold at night. We didn't feel very safe in this place and asked for a refund of our next night... which is not possible because we are not eligible even with very good reasons to want to leave the place....

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Tiny space, clean, nowhere to relax/socialise
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The location was conveniently close to some good places in Hollywood, the staff was friendly. The beds that are shown have more space than what i was given, these would have been preferred as you could use the space, I have used these non closed in beds at another podshare and they were better than what i was given here. Nice Farmers market right near here on Sunday.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Staff was not there when i arrived to check in, no obvious signage to where the entrance was. I had a bed that i would call a kennel, i had to crawl into it, anyone taller would barely fit, I hit my head a few times and i am not tall, there was no TV in this kennel, I asked for a towel that i didn't get, for what I paid for one night I was disappointed. the shared space was one table that mostly had stuff over it, there was nowhere to relax, outside was a vacant small street. the bathroom and toilet is one room, having to wait for others.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: nothing

reviews_list.Review_Likes: Super cozy and clean beds, friendly and helpful staff and overall a really good vibe
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Snoring - but that's inevitable in any shared room!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room

reviews_list.Review_Likes: great place
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: okay night little different should got with another person at night

reviews_list.Review_Likes: We got a great rest 😌. We've booked another night.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Everything was perfect.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Awesome concept, meet cool people, great location and price!
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Very cool concept. Met many cool people. Everyone is very respectful of others things and space. Awesome location right in Hollywood. Price that can’t be beat.

The location was ideal, very comfortable, and clean!
Albert was amazing as well, extremely helpful and friendly! Overall was a great stay and we will be back!

reviews_list.Main_Review: central location, nice open plan, good vibe & big double pod
reviews_list.Review_Likes: All good
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Was just cold at night on our visit (but it is Feb) and LA is having some dodgey weather ha

reviews_list.Review_Likes: nice
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: n/a

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: i want my money back! my photos show the comparison…
reviews_list.Review_Likes: this was my most liked podshare as far as location, staff and interior.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I had to sleep in something resembling a dog kennel. no air flowing inside a very narrow space. this pod was nothing like advertised. claustrophobic pod with no ventilation.. I felt deceived. the other pods were spacious with head room and freedom to stretch and move around.  I couldn’t even sit up freely in this kennel space.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: good location and bed was comfortable
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The woman working there was very unfriendly and told us nothing about the hostel when we checked in (we had to ask where the bathroom was etc. and she told us nothing about the shared food). She was also very unhelpful when we asked for any recommendations and just looked like she didn’t want to be there. There was fruit rotting in the kitchen and only one bathroom (shower and toilet) is not enough for 14 people. There was also a huge lack of privacy and another guest watched us whilst we slept and with only one bathroom it’s hard to get changed, let alone shower. This place could easily be so much better if the person working there was more interested and there were curtains on the bunks.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: This place was pretty clean and unique, the staff was nice and it was close to many things. I’ve stayed in a lot of hostels and usually really enjoy the atmosphere...
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The beds looked comfortable, so when they had us choose which queen we wanted we had no idea the one we selected (because it looked easier to climb) wasn’t actually a mattress at all...it was 2 inches of foam and extremely uncomfortable, unlike all the other real mattresses. It also got very hot, and there was a good amount of noise happening after quiet hours. Usually not a big deal if the dorm rooms are actually separate rooms...but everything was happening in one place. I was sadly pretty disappointed in this hostel.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: It’s very well decorated, but the dirty and disorganization makes it look really bad
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
it was extremely dirty and disorganized. The place is a big room where the beds stay with the kitchen, “reception” and everything else. The person who received us didn’t seem to be willing to give more info about anything we asked and when she was done with the check in she didn’t say we were all set, I had to ask because she started doing other things on the computer while we were waiting. Getting to the top beds are extremely hard with the type of “ladder”.
As it’s only a not big enough room where there’s no space to socialize, after 10pm everybody is supposed to be quiet and they turn off all the lights. 
Me and my friend decided not to sleep at the place not even take a shower.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: it was in a little street off of Hollywood blvd making it very well placed for activities in the heart of Hollywood
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It was hard to find at first, the place smelled like weed and a gym locker room, it wasn’t very clean, nowhere to really set your bags down and open them up especially since we were supposed to get the single beds which are almost fully enclosed apart from where you enter at the head.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Avoid unless you really can't afford better.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The host Evan was a good guy
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Mentally unstable guest living there. All our important stuff, passports, computers was locked in a locker without a key for 3 days in the end we had to buy bolt cutters to open it ourselves. No curtains. Cockroaches running around the palace. No refund offered for two unstayed nights because of the issues we faced.

reviews_list.Main_Review: we don’t stay here because of the dirty and the bad odor

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The decor was cool. Location was great.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
Well there is no privacy at all. They leave the door open in the daytime so anyone can just walk off the street in the place.  One bathroom for 6 ppl that's not clean AT ALL.  
The staff took cash for and extended stay but when I realized I didn't want to stay they got rude and snooty and refused to give me a refund. Police had to be called. DONT STAY HERE AT THE HOLLYWOOD LOCATION IF YOU WANT PEACE AND QUIET. Also the place gives me sex trafficking watchers type vibe..PERIOD.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Gute Lage am Hollywood Blvd. und niedriger Preis für LA.

Alle waren freundlich und sehr hilfsbereit.
Es war immer jemand der dort arbeitet vor Ort.
Die Lage war sehr gut, wir mussten nur aus unserer Straße raus laufen und waren direkt am Walk of Fame.

La ubicación, el wifi y la cocina con todas los elementos necesarios (condimentos, utensilios, heladera, freezer, etcétera). El lugar cuenta con dos mesas grandes, sillones, televisores y hasta una X-Box si quieres distraerte.
Ubicación muy céntrica, todo bien, personas amables, ningún problema

Rezeption war sofort und immer verfügbar, alles sehr entspannt. Wir konnten vollkommen problemlos spät auschecken. Bettbugs gibt es entgegen einiger Bewertungen hier nicht, insgesamt ist die Unterkunft wirklich in Ordnung.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Great value for your $, wish they would turn off the air vents at night so people didn’t get sick. Wish bathroom time li
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The value for the money was amazing! It was nice that free bananas & filtered water were offered daily. it was nice having a full kitchen available.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I enjoyed the type of property this is.. Idk why so many people stayed, but I do know this stay gave over 20 people I'm assuming, a place to stay. What a nice idea. I slept in a room of 8 people and barely noticed anyone. Reminder* this is not the most mod or potentially safe but I had no problems and slept v well. I reccomend top bunk! Bathrooms are nice too :)) thanks so much to the owner hope your intentions were well making this project I assume. All in all give this place 7/10 no down rating in any particular manner I said 7, cuz I feel it suggest how good it actually is without having the high expectations people let down. I reccomend anyone else to take this stay if they were in the same position, making something out of life. It can be a difficult journey but this place was right on time. Safe travels!!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
El alojamiento en si es bastante grande y tiene mucho espacio, la cocina tiene muchas cosas para comer que son de los residentes pero le faltaron más utensilios de cocina. El patio es grande y puedes aparcar, Richard el dueño te cobra 25 dólares si le pagas al contado por noche y no 28-29 como lo hace Booking.
Tienes comercio cercano súper mercados, locales de comida rápida y tiendas otras. 
El metro está algo lejos pero puedes tomar el bus para acercarte a Slauson que es la estación y por la calle del mismo nombre.
Por la noche el sector es bastante oscuro si tienes miedo de salir por la noche mejor no lo hagas.
El sector residencial no es muy limpio y puedes ver bastantes vagabundos pero ellos no te molestan, tiene su encanto eso si te gusta ver cómo es en realidad la vida en distintos puntos.

At the next morning, I asked for a room change to a women's room, and they did, but under me, it was a crazy woman that had bedsheets covering the bunk, and the first thing entering the room was her advertising me if I take down her "tent" I was going to be in trouble, and also listening to her mass and religious songs until 1 a.m also bordered my sleep.

reviews_list.Main_Review: price-quality ratio. quiet area. accept cash.
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
I will write the whole situation with this hostel below.
Positive sign: Big bath towels.  clean linens.  The new building of the hostel is very clean and comfortable.  Each dormitory room has its own bathroom for a common room, this one is very comfortable and intimate.  There is a kitchen and a common room with amenities.  open roof with a view of the lights of LA.
well, a very small plus of the hostel administration, that we were nevertheless moved to another hostel building, to another clean common room.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
my boyfriend and I flew to LA at 10 pm.  and check-in at this hostel is until 12. due to the situation at the border, we had to linger.  until 1 am.  Our request for a late check-in was categorically denied by the hostel administration.  and that night, in the truest sense of the word, we had to spend on the street. 
Booked a room in a shared room for men and women.  in the end, they began to settle in a room with full of men.  the room smelled awful.  it was dirty.  all the belongings of the guests were scattered on the floor, not to step through. we were offered a room in a building through the wall. the other, new building of the hostel was much cleaner and cozier than the first option.
if you arrive by car, please note that parking on the road next to the hostel is unrealistic.  as the hostel is in a residential area.  Parking on site is very small and super inconvenient.  parking fee $10-night.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: This place was never cleaned. I stayed for 4 days and the only tissue I saw was when the girl in the bunk next to mine offered me some. One morning I went to three different bathrooms and not one had tissue. The bathroom was never cleaned (saw another girl from my room cleaning up trying to help). A man came into the women’s room around 3:30am on my third night saying he thought it was the bathroom. Front door is always open and folks hanging in and out of that open door all night/morning. They had several issues with my payment after I had paid. The lady working check ins is nice but not tech savvy. Truly a mess.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: it was so dirty. the stove was broken so they had a white garbage over it with words written on it that it’s broken. the sink hasn’t been washed in ages so had built up residue, mild, fungus garbage etc. the bath mat in the washroom was blackened from what looked like black mold. I was also in the top bunk and the railing for it was halfway broken. thankfully I’m a really light person so it could hold my weight but if it were a heavy person I know that bunk ladder would’ve snapped right off. super dangerous.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Everything

reviews_list.Main_Review: Looked great in the photos, but not a good place.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Staff was very friendly. I think they were probably not trained properly, or have little experience in what a hostel is supposed to be like.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
Rooms were filthy. Debris under bed has probably been there for weeks, or  possibly months. Kitchen had no dishes, pots and pans. There were 2 spoons and a knife. That's it!
I've never stayed at a hostel that had absolutely nothing in the kitchen. Crazy!
Smoke detectors were beeping all over the place. I informed staff that batteries needed replacement. Solution was to disconnect batteries, which did not stop beeping because smoke detectors are hard wired. Beeping for 2 days drove me crazy!
This is also a very serious safety concern. If power goes out, no smoke detectors to warn guests.
No place for guests to congregate and socialize. Only few cheap hard plastic chairs in kitchen area.
This hostel should had made sure they were ready before they opened. Apparently, they just opened recently. They were not ready to open.
Also, toilet paper was almost impossible to come by if you were not an early riser. They put out a roll in the morning, and that's it, unless you can hunt somebody down to beg for another roll! Hope you can hold it! Lol!
This hostel has enormous potential. It is in a very nice neighborhood. Unfortunately, the neighbors will probably start complaining about the debris and cigarette butts between the sidewalk and roadway. They don't allow smoking inside the gate,  so guests congregate outside the gate. I am certain the neighbors are not liking this. They also have not mowed the area between the sidewalk and roadway in weeks, if ever! It is overgrown and looks horrible.
When the neighbors walk their dogs, they cross the street! I don't blame them! I am certain this hostel's days are numbered if they don't attempt to "fit in" to this very nice neighborhood. You can't have people hanging outside the gate smoking weed and drinking booze on the sidewalk. The neighbors are not going to put up with this for long.

I wouldn’t stay there again for this reason.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Well priced, great concept, & just tolerable on the cleanliness.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Love the style & the decorating, great modern upbeat & positive decor, staff was very helpful & cordial. Also great location at that price point!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The main thing was cleanliness. For sure the rooms and facilities are organized and “tidy”, but not thoroughly clean. Things like greasy residue on some walls in the bathroom, accumulation of dust in the corners behind beds and on the fan, sheets that may still contain a stain from a previous tenet, or dark marks on the doors where shoes have touched or maybe where hands have been around the door handle. Having a detailer come through and do a thorough deep cleaning of the walls and base boards and then diligent cleaning of the bathroom will bring the whole thing together b/c the idea is fabulous!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Single Bed in Mixed Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: very nice place but too many guests for its size.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: was well kept. good late hours checkin. one staff person was a bit friendly. interior was nice. perfect for a place to crash if you have a car or use a  LYFT.  i liked that the Wi-Fi and other pertinent info was very easy to find and understand.. the place is obviously cared about and for!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: too many people/guests for the small common areas & toilets. breakfast time bottlenecking.. nowhere to sit and eat and relax before the mandatory 10am early checkout, unless you got to the four chaired table first.    can’t cook/prepare own meal.. lounge room closed off and cliquey, like a vip room.. constant boring reggae playing in such a small common  room..  entrance door doesn’t push outward from inside (fire code requires outward opening doors from inside for 50+ people) nonetheless, was difficult to enter and exit with roll luggage and backpack. didn’t like the 25$ deposit (nor the reason for it) when there was no key and accidents could happen in such a small space)…

Although there is different designed furniture to suit different people in a variety of rooms, there is a need to have more space especially for bags in rooms, small personal belongings in beds, and temporary storage for luggage.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: This hostel was one of the cutest hostels I have stayed so far. I am traveling since 2018 around the world. The whole interior was soo lovely set up. I have stayed in a girls dorm. There were big lockers for each person and a lot of mirrors. Each room had a name ( my one pelican) and the wall was covered in it. Bathrooms are big and provide with shower gel and shampoo. Every bathroom was equipped with a hair dryer too. Breakfast was included. Good selection for a free breakfast in a hostel. Fridge is provided but I didn't saw any stove.  Good location. Friendly staff. Good Internet.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: DANGEROUS and UNSAFE stay. I reported to police and am still being charged. Incompetent crook owner.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: This was a horrifying experience. After booking a female only room, I was assigned a mixed-dorm and contacted the property to be told that they were sold out. Around midnight, I was awoken by another gentleman talking to himself saying, "I'm mad because they won't let me smoke in the house. I want to let the air out of all of the tires in the neighborhood. I will take a hammer to every single girl in this house. They never suspect the nice guy"I informed the worker there, we called the police, and I left. The hostel owner is still charging me for this experience.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: not for women unless you want troubles

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
home to many shady shepherds

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Is your only other option sleeping in your car? Then stay here.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: It was very clean. Nice furnishings/kitchen on first floor. That is all there is to be liked.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
Booked in mixed dorm full of men when I specifically reserved Female room.
Each room has 10 beds and 1 bathroom- unlike most hostels that have a row of showers and a row of toilets and a row of sinks so multiple people can get ready at one time-- THIS place puts 10 people to share 1 master bathroom. So if your roommate decides he needs to sit on the toilet for a half hour, NO ONE else has access to a toilet or shower or sink. It's all in one room- I've never seen a hostel like this. Whoever designed this clearly hasn't stayed in one. The layout makes no sense. 4 bedrooms with 10 people each: that's 40 people with 4 toilets but you only have access to the bathroom that is assigned to your room so if it is occupied, you can't use another bathroom.
Cleaning lady NEVER. SHUTS. UP. Constant complaining, dropping N-word, F-word, drinking wine at 8am. No one wants to hear this after a day of traveling. No chance of peace and quiet here. This place is one step above a halfway house. A Mix of foreign tourists and unhoused locals.
Guest from another country was mugged walking back from the bus stop. Workers telling him he shouldn't have worn red and blue shoes in gang territory. He was scared and confused and they were telling him "I told you so" over and over again.
I wanted a partial refund as I refused to return for my 2nd night stay but ALL day as I tried to cancel online I received an error message to "try again later". I tried ALL DAY until it was too late to cancel. I still didn't go back. My safety is more important but I DESERVE a refund for the 2nd night. Messages to the person in charge were met with responses of "first I'm hearing of this" and other fragmented, partial sentences. I don't think they know how to speak in complete sentences and clearly don't know how to run a business.
Paid for 2 nights, stayed one. Impossible to cancel online despite suggestion of partial refund being...
