reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Basic, good for a short stay, and excellent value for the neighborhood.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Ceiling fans and A/C unit in the room is very important for ventilation; was thrilled to see those. Excellent location and great value. Not a luxury hotel by any means, but for a maintenance solo traveler, it's great. Be prepared for the usual inconveniences of a hostel and shared bedroom.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I would have liked lockers IN the rooms, instead of in the communal space, but not a big deal. The bathrooms weren't super clean, but they weren't super dirty either. Same for the kitchen. Acceptable all around.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Kinda everything, but not really:))
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: That’s hard to remember:))

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The only thing I liked was the location. There is nothing else I liked about this accommodation. The only thing I can say is that is Cheap.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The house has 4 rooms with 6 beds each and two toilets. It seems that some people are living there permanently. I asked a question on Booking.com and get no response rather than the house rules. I have to wait until 6 am to feel like I am not disturbing. However, the communication with the guests should be on two sides. Not only the rules and dealing with them. thank you but I do not think I will be going back to this place.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Great place  Room and common area clean. Location can't be beat for West LA, walkable to Sawtelle, bus system to Westwood and Santa Monica. I found street parking within a few blocks, though this was weekday, winter. No security issue walking, day or night.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Eating area not too clean, though this was guests not picking up after themselves, not hostel's fault.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Everyone there was super cool and helpful. Definitely recommend this place.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: N/A

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Male Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: I like the self- check in.  I like the comfy bed and the open kitchen and strong wifi.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The roommates were a bit sketchy and sold the hostel was really just a house it was hard to get privacy.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Main_Review: Ok for the price but I would not have stayed there longer.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: It was easy to get in the house and in the rooms with the informations provided. Only a 10 minute drive to the Santa Monica beach.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: It's a guesthouse more than a hostel and it is not oriented around tourism. There is no staff and people living there seemed to be long term guests. The comon areas where more or less clean as people were leaving their personnal belongings a little bit everywhere and the room I was in only had two bedside tables which were fully occupied by the two girls already there. It was ok for the night as it was on of the cheapest options in the area but I would not have stayed there more.

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The location
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Don't look like on the pictures, smells VERY bad. Not organized. Don't have a manager in the house. We're a thousand of boys clothes in my room and old stuff someone left there. There was a bag under my bed. Looks like someone was living there and just left for me and my friends be there for the weekend. Was weird!

reviews_list.Room_Type: Bunk Bed in Female Dormitory Room
reviews_list.Review_Likes: No room was available for me at check in time. I called multiple times throughout the day for a code to access my room and every time they said they would send it to me and never did. Two hours after check in time, the manager came to the hostel and told me there was no room available for me at that location and offered a room at a different place a mile away and offered to drive me there. Communication was poor and handled unprofessionally. As a solo female traveler, it caused a lot of stress and made me not trust the managers or the stay, so I decided to leave and last minute find other options.

reviews_list.Main_Review: At first, no problem. Then I was assaulted.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Inexpensive. Modern. On-location washer and dryer.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Another guest lied about me and claimed I was in his bed. I was not, and management was called. I was asked to leave, in spite of their being no evidence that I had been in his bed or was provoking him in any way. While I was packing, I was attacked by the employees and several of the other guests, five of them grabbed me and my belongings and destroyed my hat and sprayed me with mace. I had to call the police. Their unprovoked assault resulted in multiple lacerations and bruises. I had to leave in the middle of the night.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Don’t be fooled by the price! DO NOT book here. PERIOD. Save the hassle and book elsewhere.
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The reviews I’ve read before applying for the hostel has never been so true. The place not even had a mere resemblance of what the photos portrayed. It smelled absolutely awful, very unsanitary and unclean plus the conditions of the property catered more to a homeless community than anything else. I’m talking about ghetto housing development criteria. Some dudes looked like cocoons wrapped in their beds while some stared into nothingness. Creepy stuff I say. Never again. Not even a glimpse of hope or friendly gesture was seen. Very sad indeed.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Finding the property was preferably difficult at night. Took around 15-20 minutes to locate until I saw a small informal sign for check-in. Place is hoarded with people to an astronomical scale. Ridiculous. reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: I had prebooked and paid. Arrived and was given my booked room in female 4 bed dorm. After setting up the manager came in and said I'd been given the wrong room. His co worker showed me my new room. I again set up and was in bed when the manager again come to my room and demanded that I was not to sit on a bed untill he saw my reservation. I explained that I had been directed to that room by his coworker. I hadn't allocated myself the room. I showed my reservation and that settled the matter. Then exhausted from 17hr flight and time differences I got into bed. Soon another guest returned to this room. Then I found out I was in a mixed dorm. I then vacated the room to find the manager. The manager said there wasnt a bed left in the female dorm. That was the only bed available. I explained that I had prebooked and payment had been taken for a female 4 bed room. Again the manager said he didnt have a female dorm room bed as it was already booked. I stated that I could only stay in a dorm that I booked and was not responsible for the double booking nor was the business able to adjust my booking without agreement. In my view putting me in one without advising me created an unsafe experience of the business and not what I was expecting booking.com for me to accept. The manager refused to listen or resolve the matter with me. Thus at 8pm I needed to vacate this booking and search for accommidation. I felt the manager was agressive and was relieved to be exiting the premesis. There were no key locks for dorm rooms as stated in the advertising. Alltogether this experience was shattering and not what I had expected from booking.com. I would not recommend this business. I have been left with the task of trying to get the expense reimbursed by booking.com as the manager refused to advise booking.com that the dorm had been double booked. The co worker was kind but had no say in the managers decisions.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: It is the worst thing in a hostel in Los Angeles. Never stay here. The staff in charge do not provide quality service. I had to receive a mail correspondence and they gave it to me as lost. Never, but never stay here.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
1) When I got there I realise there was a reason there weren't any photos of the outside. It was just someone's house. Like someone just lived there and they rented out the spare bedroom
2) I booked a private room with a shared bathroom, got there they tell me they don't have single rooms
3) the room I was placed was someone's bedroom. There were clothes in the closet, and personal items all over the bathroom. One of the bed was fully made with like personal sheets with multiple baskets around the bed
3) Felt fully unsafe. The room I was placed in locked from the inside but could not be locked once i left. Not to mention the type of lock was was kind that could be unlocked from the outside 
4) The door to the actual housing area didn't have a door knob.  Like, there was a hole in the door where the door handle should have been. 
5) They didn't know I was coming. They needed me to show the booking on my own phone. When I got there they had to make my bed. Like I got there and they had to make my bed 
6) Just a random group of people, I'm assuming the owners friends, were smoking in the garage. Didn't feel safe at all
7) Felt so unsafe that I literally booked another hostel, this time with HI Los Angeles. They were amazing. Very safe there. 
I would have taken photos of the conditions if i wasn't focused on getting out of there
 
HINT: If when looking up the place on Google maps, if the name of the Hostel/Hotel/Motel doesn't come up, then it's not a good place

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
******DO NO STAY HERE!******
The room I booked was billed as Single room with shared bath. When I got there Staff told me no private rooms existed and if I wanted my money back I would have to take that up with booking.com I remember seeing it said "No refunds" when I booked the room so I wasn't going to even open that can of worms. Staff seemed surprised when I didn't cancel, no doubt they were expecting to keep my money & rent out the bed to the next person, I was there for 3 nights. The property description included a Jacuzzi/Hot Tub, there was not one nor were there any signs there had been one. The place was cleaned daily but I couldn't help feeling like I was in a park restroom that had just been hosed down with disenfectant. The thing I found really unnerving was the fireworks, they would start mid-day and go well into the night sometimes till 1-2am. These fireworks were not the nice ones that do Sparks or burst into the sky, these were ones that had no visual component and made a sound nearly identical to gun fire. It seemed to me that it was a deliberate effort to desensitize you to the sound of gunfire.

Honestly felt very unwelcomed. Like I entered someones home uninvited. I went there for a 3 day concert that finished around 10:30 pm and by the time we could leave the stadium it was 12. Most of the guests there were also going to the concerts. We let the host know this in advance. We'd leave at 8am and come back at 12 am to sleep.So I really don't understand the hostility towards us specially when all the other guests were very rowdy. Q

reviews_list.Review_Likes: the room was clean but the air-condition was not so good. the restroom was shared with other people so it was difficult to wait a long time for my turn. the park inside the property costs extra 5 dollars

reviews_list.Main_Review: Terrible, Awful rude nasty smelly place racist asian owner don't book here dangerous and they leave
reviews_list.Review_Likes: Owner was upset that I left an honest review for my previous stay. She Threw my money back at me and then asked me why I was here? A white homeless female checked in after me and they went out of the way to greet her and we're very very nice to her. The place smelled so bad I almost vomited and asked for a refund. No one wore a mask. The entire family lives in this house and there's no room for guests except for the bed or outside.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: Nothing. Only 2 restrooms and a sign that says 10 minute limit. The entire house is filled with Junk and clutter on top of the disgusting fish kimchi smell. There's a big dining room table but only for family use. Guest must go to the kitchen and use the small table and tiny hard metal stools. The air vents in the restroom don't work ,so when someone goes to the restroom you can smell it and it takes an hour to not smell the feces. Each room has 3-4 beds crammed in and again no masks while you're with perfect strangers. Small airline blanket and junk all in the rooms. They have a big new refrigerator but paying guest can't use it they must go to the back porch and use the old rusty run down crowded fridge that has old spoiled food. I left to get food and they almost started cheering and said Byeeee. I said I'm not leaving I just got here. The young son came to me asking me if I was taking photos of the place Whule I was looking for urns. My father passed away and this was a last minute emergency stay. I told him my name and he didn't like my Mrs. Title mind you I have 2 grown-up children his age. Also they were gossiping about me in korean. Yes I do understand some korean. This place should be banned. It used to be better years ago maybe they're the new owners or just lazy and broke. They take advantage of ppl especially African Americans who are the #1 customer staying there. It's in a decent area but it was very unsafe getting there at night. I was bullied into leaving a good review but I can't think of anything good or positive to say about this place. Again the lady is very aggressive and mean. Her japanese husband is quiet and let's her get away with treating customers badly. I'd rather sleep on a bed of rocks than pay to be here. Disgusting but for the homeless people here I guess it's better than skid row. Horrible and I can't believe that booking.com has this place listed.

reviews_list.Review_Likes: No bunk beds which was a pleasant feature for a hostel.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: The owners were rude and aggressive which made me feel very uncomfortable and not welcome. They were consistently micromanaging me and interfering in my privacy.while at the property. Constantly coming into the room without knocking and as early a s 9:00am. I was told upon arrival that an extra 3% would be charged on my credit card even though there is no mention of this in the booking and you can only reserve a room on Booking with a credit card. I refused to pay this accordingly so and the woman still overcharged my card without my consent. I was told I was not allowed to hang clothes or my towel on the room divider as it made the room look like a homeless shelter which I found very offensive. She came into my room at 10:00am and yelled at me for this and ripped off my clothes and towel that were hanging on the divider. I was really shaken up after this experience as I informed her I was in a virtual meeting for work yet she kept yelling at me. A horrible way to experience your morning! The only reason I didn't checkout was because I wouldn't get refunded my money. I was not thanked for my business or acknowledged while checking out of the property. There are signs telling you no alcohol, no taking a shower after 11:00pm or before 7:00am and to limit your time to 10 minutes.Also everyone must takes their shoes off at the door and wear the slippers provided or your own. Overall I would not recommend as you are staying in someone's private house which you will not feel welcome and you are watched and monitored constantly including having the owners inappropriately entering your room. There were also some issues with other guests being inappropriate and disrespectful even to the point of being verbally abusive but yet it was not handled very well at all by the owners and I did not feel it was a safe place for women to stay.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: 1.- The staff and apparently owners of the house, they are not fluent in English, which is really necessary on these times. both are really nice persons, but the wife never use mask inside the house, I saw her face all the time. The husband used to mask many times, but to talk, he removed. They never push the tenants to use the mask inside the house either. The wife was really sweet and cook the dinner for thanksgiving.  Is a kitchen in the house, but you can´t used it. Only the microway, toasted oven and the water dispenser machine. Two bathrooms for the whole house, I have to say that I never need to wait more than 5 minutes for the toilette. The upstairs bathroom has the ventilator broken and has no windows. You can't ventilate the bathroom. Ventilation of the close spaces is the key to avoid Covid. Tenants and guests had a small refrigerator outside the kitchen, but basically, the kitchen is for the owners/couple. 2.- I booked and request via message to be placed in the 4 beds room, which looks the biggest in the house and the beds was spread apart. Instead, I was located in a 3 beds room, luckily I had only one "roomie", she arrived drunk quite late. When I arrive at the property to the room was empty so I took the bed next to the window. I had the window open all the time, as I didn´t feel confident with the cough of the "roomie" 3.- Some guests are more long term tenants 4.- The neighbourhood is huge. And the exteriors of the house are not well maintained. buckets of paint are stocked around and material used in the past to improve the house. On the porch are two tables, so I ate outside to avoid eating in the "living room" wich connect directly with one of the rooms and has two beds dissembles next to the table. In the pictures look nice, but the place is not well maintained and organized. Even with the same layout, they could improve a lot. The kitchen is there, but you can't use it.

reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
Weird vibe, hostel inhibited by random dudes(these are not fellow travelers, they live there), they are not friendly.. Language is not a problem, we have traveled the entire world and we have made friends with people who don't speak the same language very easily.It was something else. These dudes were very very sketchy.
They occupy the entire common area(entire couch & dining table) so very difficult to hang out in common area, no place to sit or watch TV.
Bed is cheap metal makes noises - mattress is very cheap, very uncomfortable. No locker/safe to keep your belongings. Entire house was creaky and noisy at night as the walls are thin
.
Only 1 thermostat for entire house - random dudes mentioned above set the heating to 86F(30C) - so hot! It was burning inside our room. We went and deceased the temp to 72F, to be comfortable (ideally sleep temp should be even lower). After some time, dudes again increased temperature to 90F(32C). It extremely hot and very difficult to sleep.

reviews_list.Main_Review: The hosts were nice but the guest made me feel uncomfortable while they lived in the space doing whatever they pleased b
reviews_list.Review_Likes: The hosts were nice, the property was organized and the bed was comfortable.
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes: There are rules that were not communicated to me when I booked therefore made me uncomfortable when I was scolded about something I never knew was an issue. Like not eating in the room, which I understood but I would feel more comfortable eating alone than with everyone and I do clean up after myself. And the no shoes in the house rule, which I also understand but had I known that when I booked I would have been prepared with socks because the floor did leave dirt on my feet. The other guest there made complaints about me and instead of coming to me with their issue, they exaggerating the truth which also made me feel uncomfortable as they were not the same race as me and seemed as if they wanted to make me feel unwelcomed. And while they had a problem with me, I never once addressed them for having the back door wide open at night time that kept causing me to wake up because I was freezing cold and also had flies flying around my face. As I was only a visitor of California, I did not make it my priority to go to sleep early so when I would come back at 12am, lights would be out in the rooms and kitchen and it seems like I would have nowhere to where to eat then if there is no eating in the room and lights had to be out in the kitchen after a certain time.

reviews_list.Main_Review: Give them a chance, they're just starting up.
reviews_list.Review_Likes:
Cleanliness of the place, spacious place.. it was immaculate and spotless! They had Large bathrooms. They let us check in really late which we appreciate so thank you. 
Oksana and Camila are lovely people and I had great convos with Oksana. She also offered food that she made for the rest of her friends/family that were there. 
The home is beautiful overall! 
Free parking on site and on street as well which was a plus!
reviews_list.Review_Dislikes:
These guys have just started this hostel and I don't want to be negative as I know growing a business takes time. So instead of negative comments, I'd like to give some constructive  feedback.
Remember hostels are created by cultures, people and vibes, thats my overall message as a person who has worked and lived in hostels for the last 3 years.. So I would suggest the following:
1. Reasonable pricing: You can call this place a hostel and charge the prices you charge in comparison to your competitors, if only you provide the basic hostel etiquette and amenities for your occupants.
2. Please provide lockable lockers for your guests. This is so our valuables are safe, we carried around our laptops as one of the other guests seemed very crook.
3. Have a system and a reception!  A proper desk space with a computer and a proper booking system would create a professional environment and you would be valued as a business. Instead of someone taking a random photo of our IDs on their phone. He also came and asked THE GUESTS which beds were free the next day. This is knowledge that you should already have.
4. Communal space should be accessible freely at anytime. I've seen comments about this being a family hostel. And I see that's what you are trying to create, but it was a very uncomfortable experience in general. The common spaces were occupied by friends of the property owner majority of the time who didn't speak English and didn't try to make the guests feel welcome or start conversations with them. We all know basic english even if its small conversation. Ive traveled the world and felt more welcomed in a small ethiopian village without a word of english than i did here. We sat in the room on the floor as we there was no where to sit and relax as no one interacted with us.
5 . No sleeping in communal areas. people slept on the sofas overnight the two nights we were there. It was hard getting up early to prepare food or even coffee.
6..
